projects.name: Entre-purrrr-neurship
projects.blurb: KeyPaws is my side project that uses AI to protect your computer from cats on your keyboard.

projects.name: Learning to draw
projects.blurb: This year I am learning to draw as I'd love to be a better illustrator and it's a beautifully meditative thing to do and gets me away from the screen. I am learning with the help of a painting and drawing course with the London Art College and a fantastic book Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain. So far I'm really enjoying it and will aim to post regular updates here.

projects.name: Mindfulpuss
projects.blurb: Mindfulpuss is an experimental podcast that encourages you to live life in the meow.

projects.name: Open Democracy: Comment Incentives
projects.blurb: This upcoming project, funded by Grant for the Web, seeks to incentivise high quality comments on digital journalism using the new Web Monetization draft web standard specification.

projects.name: Ask EveryDoctor
projects.blurb: At the height of the pandemic I developed a survey tool for campaigning organisation EveryDoctor to track PPE in the NHS.

projects.name: Pembroke House
projects.blurb: Working with The Small Axe and their designer Rosalba Ellis, I built a fully customisable website for Pembroke House, a centre for social action and residential community in Walworth.

projects.name: Automating myself
projects.blurb: All web projects share the same foundations. JAMstack Starter condenses my sixteen years of experience building accessible and privacy-friendly websites and apps into an open-source starter template to robustly jumpstart new projects.

projects.name: Gwen Hustwit
projects.blurb: Made possible by JAMstack Starter, Gwen's affordable, accessible website—fully editable and customisable via a CMS—was put together in a single day of collaboration in Crystal Palace.

projects.name: Lead Lecturer @ Ada, National College for Digital Skills
projects.blurb: In 2018 Ada needed someone to come in and finesse the design and delivery of their Software Developer and Data Analyst courses for apprentices from organisations including Google, Facebook and Hackney Council.

projects.name: Compass
projects.blurb: Collaborating with The Small Axe designer Rosalba Ellis I developed a new website for the centre-left thinktank Compass.

projects.name: Democracy Club's Election Widget
projects.blurb: Working in a distributed team well before it was trendy, I collaborated with the team at Democracy Club to develop a fully unit-tested, accessible polling station finder and election information widget in time for the 2019 election.

projects.name: Can I Vote?
projects.blurb: Collaborating with Small Axe designer Rosalba Ellis, Can I Vote highlighted to Commonwealth citizens that they were eligible to vote in the 2019 General Election

projects.name: CommitMe
projects.blurb: CommitMe was an innovative way to engage individuals and institutions on climate change, using cryptoeconomic incentives. Our MVP won an award at 2018's Future of Blockchain competition.

projects.name: Gifteth
projects.blurb: Working as part of 'full-stack crypto-economic production studio' Cryptical Studios, Gifteth was an experimental way of sending cryptocurrency with the goal of increasing adoption of Ethereum.

projects.name: Verto
projects.blurb: I led a skunkworks team of designers, developers, researchers, copywriters and influencers to create Verto, a campaigning tool that weaves together survey and story telling via short interactive video articles that educate, provoke and inspire.

projects.name: Co-founder: Blox
projects.blurb: Blox was a social network for buildings enabling communities to thrive and alternative socioeconomic systems to flourish. We were incubated by the Finance Innovation Lab's Financial Health Fellowship.

projects.name: Head of Technology @ Everledger
projects.blurb: I oversaw the design and development and delivery of the Everledger Core, a suite of services, APIs and front-end frameworks that would work with any given blockchain architecture. I was also responsible for Everledger's Information Security,

projects.name: Progressive Alliance
projects.blurb: For the 2017 election I joined Compass to help them launch the Progressive Alliance. We delivered the UK's first tactical voting tool of the 2017 General Election, as well as a host of other innovations. Beyond the screen I helped run a Barnstorm in Carlisle.

projects.name: Bridge at Waterloo: Digital Futures
projects.blurb: Climaxing in a performance of Rebecca Evans' contemporary dance David at the Southbank Centre, I led a team of novices who learnt how to code by building an app that let the audience control the performance using their phones.

projects.name: The Other
projects.blurb: With long-time collaborator Clarisse O'Dell we designed and built a set of 'robot lights' for Rebecca Evans' contemporary dance The Other.

projects.name: Co-founder @ Decoded
projects.blurb: I was CTO and Head of Innovation at Decoded, a global technology education company that has taught hundreds of thousands of people key digital skills.

projects.name: Creative Director @ .web{Devign}
projects.blurb: .web{devign} was run as a co-op and there were three of us in the studio by the time I went full-time on Decoded in 2011. We built standards-compliant, accessible websites for charities, personalities and small businesses.
